verses.verse: It happened in the ninth<WH8671> year<WH8141> of his reign,<WH4427> in the tenth<WH6224> month,<WH2320> in the tenth<WH6218> day of the month,<WH2320> that Nebuchadnezzar<WH5019> king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> came,<WH935> he and all his army,<WH2428> against Jerusalem,<WH3389> and encamped<WH2583> against it;<WH1129> and they built forts<WH1785> against it around it.<WH5439>
So the city<WH5892> was besieged<WH935> to the eleventh<WH6249> year<WH8141> of king<WH4428> Zedekiah.<WH6667>
On the ninth<WH8672> day of the fourth month<WH2320> the famine<WH7458> was severe<WH2388> in the city,<WH5892> so that there was no bread<WH3899> for the people<WH5971> of the land.<WH776>

Then a breach<WH1234> was made in the city,<WH5892> and all the men<WH582> of war<WH4421> fled by night<WH3915> by the way<WH1870> of the gate<WH8179> between the two walls,<WH2346> which was by the king<WH4428>'s garden<WH1588> (now the Chaldeans<WH3778> were against the city<WH5892> around<WH5439> it<WH3212>); and the king went by the way<WH1870> of the Arabah.<WH6160>

But the army<WH2428> of the Chaldeans<WH3778> pursued<WH7291> after<WH310> the king,<WH4428> and overtook<WH5381> him in the plains<WH6160> of Jericho;<WH3405> and all his army<WH2428> was scattered from him.<WH6327>
Then they took<WH8610> the king,<WH4428> and carried him up<WH5927> to the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> to Riblah;<WH7247> and they gave<WH1696> judgment on him.<WH4941>

They killed<WH7819> the sons<WH1121> of Zedekiah<WH6667> before his eyes,<WH5869> and put out<WH5786> the eyes<WH5869> of Zedekiah,<WH6667> and bound<WH631> him in fetters,<WH5178> and carried<WH935> him to Babylon.<WH894>

Now in the fifth<WH2549> month,<WH2320> on the seventh<WH7651> day of the month,<WH2320> which was the nineteenth<WH6240> year<WH8141> of king<WH4428> Nebuchadnezzar,<WH5019> king<WH4428> of Babylon,<WH894> came<WH935> Nebuzaradan<WH5018> the captain<WH7227> of the guard,<WH2876> a servant<WH5650> of the king<WH4428> of Babylon,<WH894> to Jerusalem.<WH3389>

He burnt<WH8313> the house<WH1004> of Yahweh,<WH3068> and the king<WH4428>'s house;<WH1004> and all the houses<WH1004> of Jerusalem,<WH3389> even every great<WH1419> house,<WH1004> burnt<WH8313> he with fire.<WH784>
All the army<WH2428> of the Chaldeans,<WH3778> who were with the captain<WH7227> of the guard,<WH2876> broke down<WH5422> the walls<WH2346> around<WH5439> Jerusalem.<WH3389>

Nebuzaradan<WH5018> the captain<WH7227> of the guard<WH2876> carried away<WH1540> captive<WH5307> the residue<WH3499> of the people<WH5971> who were left<WH7604> in the city,<WH5892> and those who fell away,<WH5307> who fell to the king<WH4428> of Babylon,<WH894> and the residue<WH3499> of the multitude.<WH1995>
But the captain<WH7227> of the guard<WH2876> left<WH7604> some of the poorest<WH1803> of the land<WH776> to work the vineyards<WH3755> and fields.<WH3009>

The Chaldeans<WH3778> broke up the pillars<WH5982> of brass<WH5178> that were in the house<WH1004> of Yahweh<WH3068> and the bases<WH4350> and the bronze<WH5178> sea<WH3220> that were in the house<WH1004> of Yahweh,<WH3068> and carried<WH5375> the brass<WH5178> pieces<WH7665> to Babylon.<WH894>
They took away<WH3947> the pots,<WH5518> the shovels,<WH3257> the snuffers,<WH4212> the spoons,<WH3709> and all the vessels<WH3627> of brass<WH5178> with which they ministered.<WH8334>

The captain<WH7227> of the guard<WH2876> took away<WH3947> the fire pans,<WH4289> the basins,<WH4219> that which was of gold,<WH2091> in gold,<WH2091> and that which was of silver,<WH3701> in silver.<WH3701>

The two<WH8147> pillars,<WH5982> the one<WH259> sea,<WH3220> and the bases,<WH4350> which Solomon<WH8010> had made<WH6213> for the house<WH1004> of Yahweh,<WH3068> the brass<WH5178> of all these vessels<WH3627> was without<WH3808> weight.<WH4948>

The height<WH6967> of the one<WH259> pillar<WH5982> was eighteen<WH8083> cubits,<WH520> and a capital<WH3805> of brass<WH5178> was on it;<WH6967> and the height of the capital<WH3805> was three<WH7969> cubits,<WH520> with network<WH7639> and pomegranates<WH7416> on the capital<WH3805> around<WH5439> it,<WH5178> all of brass: and like to these had the second<WH8145> pillar<WH5982> with network.<WH7639>

The captain<WH7227> of the guard<WH2876> took<WH3947> Seraiah<WH8304> the chief<WH7218> priest,<WH3548> and Zephaniah<WH6846> the second<WH4932> priest,<WH3548> and the three<WH7969> keepers<WH8104> of the threshold:<WH5592>

and out of the city<WH5892> he took<WH3947> an<WH259> officer<WH5631> who was set<WH6496> over the men<WH582> of war;<WH4421> and five<WH2568> men<WH582> of those who saw<WH7200> the king<WH4428>'s face,<WH7200> who were found<WH4672> in the city;<WH5892> and the scribe,<WH5608> the captain<WH8269> of the army,<WH6635> who mustered<WH6633> the people<WH5971> of the land;<WH776> and sixty<WH8346> men<WH376> of the people<WH5971> of the land,<WH776> who were found<WH4672> in the city.<WH5892>
Nebuzaradan<WH5018> the captain<WH7227> of the guard<WH2876> took<WH3947> them,<WH3212> and brought them to the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> to Riblah.<WH7247>

The king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> struck<WH5221> them,<WH4191> and put them to death at Riblah<WH7247> in the land<WH776> of Hamath.<WH2574> So Judah<WH3063> was carried away<WH1540> captive out of his land.<WH127>

As for the people<WH5971> who were left<WH7604> in the land<WH776> of Judah,<WH3063> whom Nebuchadnezzar<WH5019> king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> had left,<WH7604> even over them he made Gedaliah<WH1436> the son<WH1121> of Ahikam,<WH296> the son<WH1121> of Shaphan,<WH8227> governor.<WH6485>

Now when all the captains<WH8269> of the forces,<WH2428> they and their men,<WH582> heard<WH8085> that the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> had made Gedaliah<WH1436> governor,<WH6485> they came<WH935> to Gedaliah<WH1436> to Mizpah,<WH4709> even Ishmael<WH3458> the son<WH1121> of Nethaniah,<WH5418> and Johanan<WH3110> the son<WH1121> of Kareah,<WH7143> and Seraiah<WH8304> the son<WH1121> of Tanhumeth<WH8576> the Netophathite,<WH5200> and Jaazaniah<WH2970> the son<WH1121> of the Maacathite,<WH4602> they and their men.<WH582>

Gedaliah<WH1436> swore<WH7650> to them and to their men,<WH582> and said<WH559> to them,<WH3372> "Don't be afraid because of the servants<WH5650> of the Chaldeans.<WH3778> Dwell<WH3427> in the land,<WH776> and serve<WH5647> the king<WH4428> of Babylon,<WH894> and it shall be well with you.<WH3190>"

But it happened in the seventh<WH7637> month,<WH2320> that Ishmael<WH3458> the son<WH1121> of Nethaniah,<WH5418> the son<WH1121> of Elishama,<WH476> of the royal<WH4410> seed<WH2233> came,<WH935> and ten<WH6235> men<WH582> with him,<WH5221> and struck Gedaliah,<WH1436> so that he died,<WH4191> and the Jews<WH3064> and the Chaldeans<WH3778> that were with him at Mizpah.<WH4709>

All the people,<WH5971> both small<WH6996> and great,<WH1419> and the captains<WH8269> of the forces,<WH2428> arose,<WH6965> and came<WH935> to Egypt;<WH4714> for they were afraid<WH3372> of<WH6440> the Chaldeans.<WH3778>

It happened in the thirty<WH7970> seventh<WH7651> year<WH8141> of the captivity<WH1546> of Jehoiachin<WH3078> king<WH4428> of Judah,<WH3063> in the twelfth<WH8147> month,<WH2320> on the seven<WH7651> and twentieth<WH6242> day of the month,<WH2320> that Evilmerodach<WH192> king<WH4428> of Babylon,<WH894> in the year<WH8141> that he began to reign,<WH4427> lifted up<WH5375> the head<WH7218> of Jehoiachin<WH3078> king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> out of prison;<WH1004>
and he spoke<WH1696> kindly<WH2896> to him,<WH5414> and set his throne<WH3678> above the throne<WH3678> of the kings<WH4428> who were with him in Babylon,<WH894>
and changed<WH8132> his prison<WH3608> garments.<WH899> Jehoiachin ate<WH398> bread<WH3899> before<WH6440> him continually<WH8548> all the days<WH3117> of his life:<WH2416>

and for his allowance,<WH737> there was a continual<WH8548> allowance<WH737> given<WH5414> him of the king,<WH4428> every<WH3117> day<WH3117> a portion,<WH1697> all the days<WH3117> of his life.<WH2416>
